Cockatoos

Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo

A large, sexually dimorphic cockatoo from Australia. Males are solid black with brilliant red panels in their tail. Females are black with yellow spots and have barred orange-yellow tail panels.

Origin
Australia & Oceania
Size
22-24 inches (56-61 cm). Weight: 600-900g (21-32 oz)
Weight
750g avg.
Noise Level
Very Loud. They have a loud, drawn-out, and far-carrying call.

Looking for a Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo?

See Available Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Intelligent, active, and can be very destructive with their powerful beaks. They are not typically cuddly birds and are less common in aviculture than other cockatoos.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Not known for their talking ability. Their vocalizations are their loud, natural calls.

Dietary Needs

Specialized diet is required, as they primarily feed on the seeds of eucalyptus and other native Australian plants.

Health & Lifespan

Can live up to 50 years. They are not common as pets and have very specific dietary and aviary needs that are difficult for the average person to meet.

Housing Requirements

Requires a large, durable outdoor aviary. They are not suited for indoor cage life.

Common Questions About Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo

What is the lifespan of a Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo?

The Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo typically lives for Up to 50 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo come from?

The Red-Tailed Black Cockatoo is native to Australia & Oceania.
